summary: REQ-2 (build marker utility) and REQ-3 (cache-busting hero image URL with build marker) appear implemented in LandingPage.tsx via a new buildMarker utility and a versioned hero image URL. REQ-1 header branding looks updated to text-based “SHAMMAH” with no visible in the shown header snippet, but the diff summary does not conclusively demonstrate removal of all remaining references to the Butterfly Wellness wordmark in the header branding code path; one updated summary file still claims the asset is used in the landing page header.

missing_requirements.requirement: Ensure there are no remaining references in the frontend code to `/assets/branding/butterfly-wellness-wordmark.png` for the header branding.
missing_requirements.reason: The provided diff summary does not show removal of all references; additionally, an updated repo summary file explicitly states the Butterfly Wellness wordmark asset is used in the landing page header, which contradicts the requirement/AC.
evidence: frontend-file-summaries.txt (line describing `frontend/public/assets/branding/butterfly-wellness-wordmark.png` as "used in the landing page header")

hallucinated_features.description: Added/updated repository metadata files unrelated to the requested frontend landing page deployment/version marker changes (project state tracking and a frontend file summary index).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest asked to change app code to surface deployed version and adjust landing branding/caching; it did not request adding/changing project tracking/summary metadata files.
